message.content:
A hook is a curved or bent piece of metal or plastic used for catching, holding, or pulling something. 
It typically has a sharp point that can pierce or penetrate the object it is attached to. 
Hooks come in many shapes and sizes and can be made from a variety of materials, such as steel, brass, or nylon. 
They are often used in various contexts, such as fishing, hunting, construction, and home organization. 
Hooks can be found in a range of colors, including metallic, black, and white. 
They may also have different textures, from smooth to textured or patterned. 
The visual characteristics of a hook depend largely on its intended use, material, and manufacturing process.
